keywordspec.name: TestFXLibrary
keywordspec.doc:
TestFXLibrary is a Robot Framework test library for JavaFx.

The library allows to create automated test scripts to test Java FX applications using the TestFX framework.

Getting Started

Download

Download the latest version of TestFXLibrary from TestFXLibrary GitHub

Classpath

Running Library Locally

To be able to execute the library and the application in Robot Framework, you need to add both application and library jars to CLASSPATH.
You can add them and jybot execution to a script and run it as execution profile in Robot Framework.
Below is an example of a custom bat script:
@echo off
set LIBRARIES_FOLDER=C:\LibraryFolder
set APP_FOLDER=C:\ApplicationFolder
set CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;%LIBRARIES_FOLDER%\*;%APP_FOLDER%\*
jython -m robot.run %*

Running Remote Library

It is possible to run as a remote library. By executing the jar file, a local server is created in port 8270. You need to add the library and the application to test in the classpath when executing the jar file, to do so use java -cp command: 
java -cp "<library_path>;<app_to_be_tested_path>" <library_class_name>
Example with library and application to test in the same folder: 
java -cp "testFXLibrary.jar;testFxLibraryDemoApp.jar" TestFXLibrary
* Example with library and application to test in different folders: 
java -cp "testFXLibrary.jar;C:\TestFxLibrary\testFxLibraryDemoApp.jar" TestFXLibrary

Importing

Import TestFxLibrary in Robot Framework:

Import Library
Settings Value
Library TestFXLibrary
Remote Library
Settings Value Arguments
Library Remote http://localhost:8270/ | WITH NAME | TestFXLibrary

Example Test Case

My Test Case
Example Test Cases
Start Application testapp.FxApplication
Click On Component buttonId
Select From List View By Text listViewId Example Text
Close Application

kw.name: Capture Screen
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword takes a screenshot of the application. File extension is specified with format. This file is saved with the filename and filepath specified with the keyword Set File Path. If an error occurs a TestFxLibraryNonFatalException is thrown.


Parameter Mandatory Values Default
format Yes string (jpg, png, gif, bmp, wbmp) png

Examples:
Capture Screen jgp
Set File Path E:\MyFolder\MyInnerFolder\ myFile
Saved file: E:\MyFolder\MyInnerFolder\myFile.jpg

kw.name: Check Box Should Be Disabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword tests if a given checkbox specified with identifier is disabled

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the checkbox

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Check Box Should Be Disabled idCheckBox05

kw.name: Check Box Should Be Enabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword tests if a given checkbox specified with identifier is enabled.

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the checkbox

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Check Box Should Be Enabled idCheckBox05

kw.name: Check Box Should Be Selected
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword verifies if a checkbox specified with identifier is selected. If this checkbox is not selected a TestFxLibraryFatalException is thrown.

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the checkbox

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Check Box Should Be Selected idCheckBox05

kw.name: Check Box Should Not Be Selected
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword verifies if a checkbox specified with identifier is not selected. If this checkbox is selected a TestFxLibraryFatalException is thrown.

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the checkbox

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Check Box Should Not Be Selected idCheckBox05

kw.name: Choicebox Item Should Be Selected
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword fails if a choicebox item given by item is not selected.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component
    item : The text that you want to compare //.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
text Yes string N/A


Examples:
Choicebox Item Should Be Selected \#choicebox Text To Verify

kw.name: Choicebox Item Should Not Be Selected
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword fails if a choicebox item given by item is selected.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component
    item : The text that you want to compare //.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
text Yes string N/A


Examples:
Choicebox Item Should Not Be Selected \#choicebox Text To Verify

kw.name: Choicebox Should Be Disabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword fails if a choicebox given by identifier is enabled.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
Choicebox Item Should Be Disabled \#choicebox

kw.name: Choicebox Should Be Enabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword fails if a choicebox given by identifier is disabled.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
Choicebox Item Should Be Enabled \#choicebox

kw.name: Clear Selection From List
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword clears all items selected on a listview. identifier specifies the listview to be cleared.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the listview

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Clear Selection From List idListView2J

kw.name: Clear Text Area
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword erases all the text on the the text area specified with identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The text area to be cleared of text

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Clear Text Area TextArea02

kw.name: Clear Text Field
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword erases all the text on the the text field specified with identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The text field to be cleared of text

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Clear Text Field TextField02

kw.name: Clear Tree Selection
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword selects all the Tree Items from a Tree View identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the Tree View.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
treeView Clear Tree Selection

kw.name: Click Component At Coordinates
kw.doc:
Description:This keyword clicks on a component specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    x : position value on X
    y : position value on Y

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
x Yes int N/A
y Yes int N/A


Examples:
Click On Component At Coordinates 200, 200

kw.name: Click On Component
kw.doc:
Description:This keyword clicks on a component specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
Click On Component idComponent05

kw.name: Close Application
kw.doc: Description: This keyword closes the JavaFX application. The primary stage is hidden and cleaned up.

kw.name: Close Current Window
kw.doc: Description: This keyword closes the current focused window. If an error occurs a TestFxLibraryNonFatalException is thrown.

kw.name: Collapse Tree Node
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword collapses the Tree View specified by identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the Tree View.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
treeView Collapse Tree Node

kw.name: Colorpicker Color Should Be
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword checks if the color you specified matches the color seted in the ColorPiker specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the ColorPicker component
    colorToValidate : the color you want to Check on the ColorPiker component. The Color must be in the hexadecimal format.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
colorToValidate Yes string N/A


Examples:
/#colorPiker 0x0000ffff Datepicker Date Should Be

kw.name: Component Should Be Invisible
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword verifies if a component specified with identifier is invisible. If the given component is visible an error message is displayed.

Parameters:
    identifier : The node you want to verify

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Component Should Be Invisible idButton

kw.name: Component Should Be Visible
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword verifies if a component specified with identifier is visible. If the given component is not visible an error message is displayed.

Parameters:
    identifier : The node you want to verify

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Component Should Be Visible idButton

kw.name: Datepicker Date Should Be
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword sets the date in the DatePicker specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the DatePicker component
    dateToValidate : the date you want to Check on the DatePicker component. The Date must be in the dd-mm-yyyy format.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
dateToValidate Yes string N/A


Examples:
/#datePicker Datepicker Date Should Be 01-01-2017

kw.name: Default Wait
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword sets the default timeout for wait keywords. This value is used if another timeout is not specified.

Parameters:
    timeout : The time limit to complete the test in milliseconds

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
timeout No int 0

Examples:
Default Wait 1000

kw.name: Double Click On Component
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword double clicks on a component specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Double Click On Component idComponent05

kw.name: Drag
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword drags a component specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Drag idComponent05

kw.name: Drop
kw.doc: Description: This keyword drops a component that is being dragged

kw.name: Drop To
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword drops a component that is being dragged into a component specified with identifier

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Drop To idComponent05

kw.name: Erase Text
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword erases text from a text field. The number of characters erased is specified with numberOfCharacters.


Parameters:
    numberOfCharacters : The number of characters to be erased

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
numberOfCharacters Yes int N/A

Examples:
Erase Text 12

kw.name: Focus To Component
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword requests the focus to the component. This component is specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : Component identifier

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
#textField Focus To Component

kw.name: Get Check Box State
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the boolean value state of a given checkbox identified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the checkbox

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    Boolean value if the checkbox is selected (true) or not (false)

Examples:
${boolean}= Get Check Box State idCheckBox05

kw.name: Get Component Attribute
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword gets an attribute value of a component.

Parameters:
    identifier : The component where you want to get the attribute
    attribute : The method name of the attribute that you want

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
attribute Yes string N/A


Returns:
    Attribute value in a string

Examples:
${method}= Get Component Attribute idComponent02 attributeXYZ

kw.name: Get Component Position
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the position of a component on the screen. This component is specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : Component identifier

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    Position of component on screen

Examples:
${position2D}= Get Component Position idComponent02

kw.name: Get Component Size
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the component size with Width and Height. This component is specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : Component identifier

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    Position of component on screen

Examples:
#textField Get Component Size

kw.name: Get Hyperlink Status
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the status of an Hyperlink specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the Hyperlink component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The current status of an Hyperlink

Examples:
/#hyperlink Get Hyperlink Status

kw.name: Get Hyperlink Text
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the text within a Hyperlink specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the Hyperlink component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The text present in a Hyperlink

Examples:
/#hyperlink Get Hyperlink Text

kw.name: Get List Item Count From List
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the number of selected items on a list. This list is specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the list

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The number of items selected

Examples:
${integer}= Get List Item Count From List idList76

kw.name: Get List Items From Combo Box
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns a list of values from a combobox specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the combobox.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The list of values

Examples:
@{list}= Get List Items From Combo Box idComboBox01

kw.name: Get List Items From List View
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns a list with the values in a listview specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the listview

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The list of values

Examples:
@{list}= Get List Items From List View idListView01

kw.name: Get Matching Locator Count
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the number of instance's locators find in the window specified with identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The css class of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The number of instance's locators

Examples:
.button Get Matching Locator Count

kw.name: Get Menu Items
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the items for specific menu.


Parameters:
    identifier : The menu id
    menuName : The menu name to get the items

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
menuName Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The list of items

Examples:
Get Menu Items \# menuId menuName

kw.name: Get Menus
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the Menus specified with identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The menu id

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The list of menus

Examples:
Get Menu Items \# menuId

kw.name: Get Node All
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword gets the inner component from a given component specified with identifier

Parameters:
    identifier : The name of the component that you are going to test

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The inner component of the provided component

Examples:
${component}= Get Node Key idComponent02

kw.name: Get Node Key
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword gets the inner component from a given component specified with identifier

Parameters:
    identifier : The name of the component that you are going to test

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The inner component of the provided component

Examples:
${component}= Get Node Key idComponent02

kw.name: Get Node List
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword gets the component list within the component specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The component from where you want to get list of components

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    Attribute value in a string

Examples:
@{list}= Get Node List idComponent05

kw.name: Get Nth Element
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword gets the Nth element from a component list specified with identifier; nthElement identifies the index.

Parameters:
    identifier : The component to search

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The Nth component from the list

Examples:
${component}= Get Nth Element idComponent02

kw.name: Get Progress Bar Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the ProgressBar specified with identifier value.
Parameters:
    identifier : The progress bar id

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The value of the progress bar

Examples:
Get Progress Bar Value \# progressBarId

kw.name: Get Progress Indicator Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns value from ProgressIndicator specified with identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The progress indicator id

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The value of the progress indicator

Examples:
Get Progress Indicator Value \# progressIndicatorId

kw.name: Get Scroll Bar Max Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the maximum value of a scroll bar specified by identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
value Yes float N/A


Returns:
    The maximum value of the scroll bar

Examples:
${max_value}= Get Scroll Bar Max Value \#scrollbar

kw.name: Get Scroll Bar Min Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the minimum value of a scroll bar specified by identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The minimum value of the scroll bar

Examples:
${min_value}= Get Scroll Bar Min Value \#scrollbar

kw.name: Get Scroll Bar Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the current value of a scroll bar specified by identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The current value of the scroll bar

Examples:
${current_value}= Get Scroll Bar Value \#scrollbar

kw.name: Get Scroll Pane Horizontal Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the horizontal value of a scroll pane specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The horizontal value

Examples:
${hor_value}= Get Scroll Pane Horizontal Value \#scrollpane

kw.name: Get Scroll Pane Max Horizontal Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the maximum horizontal value of a scroll pane specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The maximum horizontal value

Examples:
${max_hor_value}= Get Scroll Pane Max Horizontal Value \#scrollpane

kw.name: Get Scroll Pane Max Vertical Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the maximum vertical value of a scroll pane specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The maximum vertical value

Examples:
${max_hor_value}= Get Scroll Pane Max Vertical Value \#scrollpane

kw.name: Get Scroll Pane Min Horizontal Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the minimum horizontal value of a scroll pane specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The minimum horizontal value

Examples:
${max_hor_value}= Get Scroll Pane Min Horizontal Value \#scrollpane

kw.name: Get Scroll Pane Min Vertical Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the minimum vertical value of a scroll pane specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The minimum vertical value

Examples:
${max_hor_value}= Get Scroll Pane Min Vertical Value \#scrollpane

kw.name: Get Scroll Pane Vertical Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the vertical value of a scroll pane specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The vertical value

Examples:
${hor_value}= Get Scroll Pane Vertical Value \#scrollpane

kw.name: Get Selected Choicebox Item
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns a String with the selected item of a choicebox specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The slected item in the choicebox

Examples:
.button Get Selected Item In ChoiceBox

kw.name: Get Selected Colorpicker Color
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the Color selected in a ColorPiker specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the ColorPiker component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The text present in a Hyperlink

Examples:
/#colorPiker Get Selected Colorpicker Color

kw.name: Get Selected Datepicker Date
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the date selected in a DatePicker specified by an identifier.
Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the DatePicker component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The date Selected on the DatePicker

Examples:
/#datePicker Get Selected Datepicker Date

kw.name: Get Selected Item From Combobox
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns a selected item from a combobox. The combobox is specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the ComboBox

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The text of the selected item

Examples:
${item}= Get Selected Item From Combo Box idComboBox23

kw.name: Get Selected Items From List
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns a list of items which are currently selected on a list. This list is specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the list

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The items selected

Examples:
@{list}= Get Selected Items From List idList23

kw.name: Get Selected Radio Button
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword get the name of the selected radio button toggle group passed by an identifier of a contained Radio Button.


Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier if the radiobutton

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The selected radio button

Examples:
radiobutton1 Get Selected Radio Button

kw.name: Get Selected Tab
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the selected tab text inside a tab pane specified by identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The selected tab text

Examples:
${tabText}= Get Tab Text \#tab

kw.name: Get Selected Treeview Nodes
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the selected items from a Tree View identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The TreeView locator

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The selected tree view item

Examples:
Get Selected Treeview Nodes \#treeView

kw.name: Get Selected Window Title
kw.doc:
Description:This keyword returns the title of the current window. If an error occurs a TestFxLibraryNonFatalException is thrown.


Parameter Mandatory Values Default

Returns:
    Title of the component

Examples:
#scrollPane #textField Scroll Component To View

kw.name: Get Tab Pane Tabs
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns a list of tabs inside a tab pane specified by identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The list of tabs inside the tabpane

Examples:
@{tabList}= Get Tab Pane Tabs \#tabpane

kw.name: Get Table Cell Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the cell value from a table specified with identifier. rowIndex and columnIndex identify row and column indexes, respectively. Indexes can take values from 0 to max row and column respectively. Index of 0 correspond to the first entry of both rows and columns. Negative numbers and indexes larger than max value for row or column throw an Exception.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the table
    rowIndex : Row to get the value from. First row has 0 index.
    columnIndex : Column to get the value from. First column has 0 index.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
rowIndex Yes int (0 to max row index) N/A
columnIdex Yes int (0 to max column index) N/A


Returns:
    The cell value

Examples:
${string}= Get Table Cell Value idTable05 2 12

kw.name: Get Table Column Count
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the number of columns from a specific table specified with identifier. Headers do not count to total.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the table

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The column count

Examples:
${integer}= Get Table Column Count idTable05

kw.name: Get Table Column Values
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword gets a list of values from a specific column of a given table. Table is specified with identifier and columnIndex specifies column index. Index of 0 does not correspond to header but to first actual column. An Exception is thrown if column index is out of bounds.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the table
    columnIndex : Column to get the values from for all rows. 0 is for first column

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
columnIndex Yes int (0 to max column index) N/A


Returns:
    List of values

Examples:
@{list}= Get Table Column Values idTable23 12

kw.name: Get Table Headers
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns a list of header values from a table specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the table

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    List of names

Examples:
@{list}= Get Table Headers idTable05

kw.name: Get Table Row Count
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the number of rows in a table specified with identifier. Headers do not count to total.

Parameters:
    identifier : The if of the table

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The number of rows

Examples:
${integer}= Get Table Row Count idTable05

kw.name: Get Table Row Values
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword gets a list of values from a specific row of a given table. The table is specified with identifier and rowIndex specifies row index. First row is specified with index 0, which does not correspond to headers. An Exception is thrown if row index is out of bounds.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the table
    rowIndex : Row to get the values for all columns. 0 is for first row

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
rowIndex Yes int (0 to max row index) N/A


Returns:
    List of values

Examples:
@{list}= Get Table Row Values idTable3A 8

kw.name: Get Table Values
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns a list with values from all rows in a table specified with identifier. Values in this list are organized by rows: values from first row come first followed by values from second row, etc.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the table

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The list of values

Examples:
@{list}= Get Table Values idTable05

kw.name: Get Tool Bar Items
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the items of a toolbar specified by identifier.
Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The list of items inside the toolbar

Examples:
@{listItems}= Get Tool Bar Items \#toolbar

kw.name: Get Tooltip Text
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the text within a tooltip specified by an identifier.
Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the component with a tooltip

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    The text present in a tooltip

Examples:
/#button2 Get Tooltip Text

kw.name: Hyperlink Should Be Disabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if Hyperlink specified by an identifier is enabled.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the Hyperlink component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
/#hyperlink Hyperlink Should Be Enabled

kw.name: Hyperlink Should Be Enabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if Hyperlink specified by an identifier is enabled.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the Hyperlink component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
/#hyperlink Hyperlink Should Be Enabled

kw.name: Hyperlink Should Be Visited
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if Hyperlink status specified by an identifier is visited.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the Hyperlink component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
/#hyperlink Hyperlink Should Be Visited

kw.name: Hyperlink Should Not Be Visited
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if Hyperlink status specified by an identifier is visited.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the Hyperlink component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
/#hyperlink Hyperlink Should Not Be Visited

kw.name: Label Text Should Be
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword validates text in a label. The label is specified with identifier and text to validate is specified with textToValidate. If text in the label does not match textToValidate a TestFxLibraryNonFatalException in thrown.


Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the label you want to verify.
    textToValidate : The text you want to validate

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
textToValidate Yes string N/A

Examples:
Label Text Should Be Label02 Hello world

kw.name: List Component Methods
kw.doc:
Parameters:
    identifier : The component identifier

Returns:
    : The component method list

kw.name: List Components In Context
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword list components in context


Returns:
    The list of components

Examples:
${list}= List Components In Context

kw.name: List Selection Should Be
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword selects all items on a listview. identifier specifies the listview.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the listview
    elements : The id of the elements that you want to validate if they are selected. The list of elements should be splited by //.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
elements Yes string N/A

Examples:
Select All From List idListView56 first//Secund//Third//Fourth

kw.name: List Target Windows
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns a list of all target windows.

Returns:
    A list of javafx.stage.Window

kw.name: List View Should Contain
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword validates if a text is present in a given list. ListView is specified with identifier and text specifies text to compare. If text is not found within identifier a TestFxLibraryNonFatalException is thrown.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the table
    text : Text to compare

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
text Yes string N/A

Examples:
List View Should Contain listView one

kw.name: List View Should Not Contain
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword validates if a text is present in a given list. ListView is specified with identifier and text specifies text to compare. If text is not found within identifier a TestFxLibraryNonFatalException is thrown.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the table
    text : Text to compare

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
text Yes string N/A

Examples:
List View Should Contain listView one

kw.name: List Windows
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns a list of all windows.

Returns:
    A list of javafx.stage.Window

kw.name: Maximize Window
kw.doc: Description:This keyword maximizes the application window. If an error occurs a TestFxLibraryNonFatalException is thrown.

kw.name: Menu Should Be Visible
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if the Menu specified with identifier is visible.


Parameters:
    identifier : The menu id

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
item Yes string N/A


Examples:
Menu Should Be Visible \# menuId

kw.name: Menu Should Have Item
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if the Menu specified with identifier should have item specified with item.


Parameters:
    identifier : The menu id
    item : The item

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
item Yes string N/A


Examples:
Menu Should Have Item \# menuId item

kw.name: Menu Should Not Be Visible
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if the Menu specified with identifier is not visible.


Parameters:
    identifier : The menu id

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
item Yes string N/A


Examples:
Menu Should Not Be Visible \# menuId

kw.name: Menu Should Not Have Item
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if the Menu specified with identifier should not have item specified with item.


Parameters:
    identifier : The menu id
    item : The item

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
item Yes string N/A


Examples:
Menu Should Have Item \# menuId item

kw.name: Move By
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword moves the mouse to an x, y location specified with xCoordinate and yCoordinate, respectively.

Parameters:
    xCoordinate : The x coordinate
    yCoordinate : The y coordinate

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
xCoordinate No double 0
yCoordinate Yes double 0

Examples:
Move By 10.2 21.0

kw.name: Move To
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword moves the mouse to a component specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Move To idComponent05

kw.name: Press
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword presses the key specified with keycode.


Parameters:
    keycode : The keycode of the key to be pressed. eg. "Enter"

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
keycode Yes string N/A

Examples:
Press Enter
Press Control
Press A
Press F10
For more information on keycodes see: https://docs.oracle.com/javafx/2/api/javafx/scene/input/KeyCode.html

kw.name: Progress Bar Should Be Disabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if the ProgressBar specified with identifier is disabled
Parameters:
    identifier : The progress bar id

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
Progress Bar Should Be Disabled \# progressBarId

kw.name: Progress Bar Should Be Enabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if the ProgressBar specified with identifier is enabled
Parameters:
    identifier : The progress bar id

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
Progress Bar Should Be Enabled \# progressBarId

kw.name: Progress Indicator Should Be Disabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if the ProgressIndicator specified with identifier is disabled


Parameters:
    identifier : The progress indicator id

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
Progress Indicator Should Be Disabled \# progressIndicatorId

kw.name: Progress Indicator Should Be Enabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if the ProgressIndicator specified with identifier is enabled


Parameters:
    identifier : The progress indicator id

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
Progress Indicator Should Be Enabled \# progressIndicatorId

kw.name: Radio Button Should Be Disabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if a radio button passed by an identifier is disable. Fails if radio button is enable.


Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier if the radiobutton

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
radiobutton1 Radio Button Should Be Disabled

kw.name: Radio Button Should Be Enabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if a radio button passed by an identifier is enabled. Fails if radio button is disable.


Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier if the radiobutton

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
radiobutton1 Radio Button Should Be Enable

kw.name: Radio Button Should Be Selected
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if a radio button passed by an identifier is selected. Fails uf is not selected.


Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier if the radiobutton

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
radiobutton1 Radio Button Should Be Selected

kw.name: Radio Button Should Not Be Selected
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if a radio button passed by an identifier is not selected. Fails uf is selected.


Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier if the radiobutton

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
radiobutton1 Radio Button Should Not Be Selected

kw.name: Release
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword releases the key specified with keycode.


Parameters:
    keycode : The keycode of the key to be released. eg. "Enter"

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
keycode Yes string N/A

Examples:
Release Enter
Release Control
Release A
Release F10
For more information on keycodes see: https://docs.oracle.com/javafx/2/api/javafx/scene/input/KeyCode.html

kw.name: Right Click On Component
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword right clicks on a component specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Right Click On Component idComponent05

kw.name: Scroll Bar Value Should Be
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword fails if the value specified by value is not the current scroll bar specified by identifier value.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component
    value : The value to verify

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
value Yes float N/A

Examples:
Scroll Bar Value Should Be \#scrollbar 95.1

kw.name: Scroll Component To View
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword scrolls the component to view in the ScrollPane witch is specified with the scrollPaneIdentifier. This component is specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    scrollPaneIdentifier : ScrollPane where component is contained
    identifier : Component identifier

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
scrollPaneIdentifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
#scrollPane #textField Scroll Component To View

kw.name: Scroll Down
kw.doc:
Description:This keyword scrolls down by the amount specified with amount.

Parameters:
    amount : The amount to be scrolled

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
amount No int 0

Examples:
Scroll Down 25

kw.name: Scroll Left
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword scrolls left by the amount specified with amount.

Parameters:
    amount : The amount to be scrolled

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
amount No int 0

Examples:
Scroll Left 25

kw.name: Scroll Right
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword scrolls right by the amount specified with amount.

Parameters:
    amount : The amount to be scrolled

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
amount No int 0

Examples:
Scroll Right 25

kw.name: Scroll Up
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword scrolls up by the amount specified with amount.

Parameters:
    amount : The amount to be scrolled

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
amount No int 0

Examples:
Scroll Up 25

kw.name: Select All From List
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword selects all items on a listview. identifier specifies the listview.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the listview

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Select All From List idListView56 hello world

kw.name: Select First From Combo Box
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword selects the first item from a combobox. The combobox is specified with identifier and text is specified with text

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the combobox.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Select First From Combo Box idComboBox01

kw.name: Select From Combo Box By Position
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword selects an item from a combobox by position. The combobox is specified with identifier and the position is specified with position, which can take values from 0 to item count minus 1; a value of -1 clears the selection.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the combobox
    position : The position to get the selected item

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
position Yes int (values from 0 to item count - 1) -1

Examples:
Select From Combo Box By Position idComboBox01 1

kw.name: Select From Combo Box By Text
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword selects an item from a combobox by text. The combobox is specified with identifier and text is specified with text

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the combobox.
    text : The text to get the selected item

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
text Yes string N/A

Examples:
Select From Combo Box By Text idComboBox01 hello world

kw.name: Select From List View By Position
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword selects an item in a listview by position. The listview is specified with identifier. The position that defines the item to be selected is specified with position, which can take values from 0 to item count minus 1; a value of -1 clears the selection.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the listview
    position : The position to get the selected item

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
posiotion Yes int (values from 0 to item count - 1) -1

Examples:
Select From List View By Position idListView01 1

kw.name: Select From List View By Text
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword selects an item in a listview by text. The listview is specified with identifier and text is the text that specifies the item to be selected.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the listview
    text : The text to get the selected item

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
text Yes string N/A

Examples:
Select From List View By Text idListView01 hello world

kw.name: Select From Popup Menu
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword selects a function from a popup menu of an component. The component is specified with identifier and the function is specified with functionText. An Exception is thrown if an error occurs.

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the component
    functionText : The name of the function that you want to select

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
functionText Yes string N/A

Examples:
Select From Popup Spinner idComponent05 aFunctionToSelect

kw.name: Select Items From List View
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword selects items on a listview specified by identifier and a list of elements.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the listview
    elements : The id of the elements that you want to validate if they are selected. The list of elements should be splited by //.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
elements Yes string N/A

Examples:
Select Items From List View idListView first//Secund//Third//Fourth

kw.name: Select Main Window
kw.doc: Description: This keyword selects the main window. If an error occurs a TestFxLibraryNonFatalException is thrown.

kw.name: Select Tab By Text
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword selects a tab specified with text inside a tab pane specified by identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component
    text : The tab text

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
text Yes string N/A

Examples:
Select Tab By Text \#tabPane Tab One

kw.name: Select Tree Node By Index
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword selects a Tree Item on the specified index index from a Tree View identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the Tree View.
    index : The index of the element

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
index Yes int N/A


Examples:
treeView Select Tree Node By Index 2

kw.name: Select Tree View Node By Text
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword seletcs a Tree Item with the specified text text from a Tree View identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : the TreeView locator
    text : the text of the node to be selected

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
text Yes string N/A


Examples:
Select TreeView Node By Text \#treeView Item Name

kw.name: Select Window
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword targets a specific window specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the window

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Select Window idWindow02

kw.name: Set Check Box State
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword sets the state of a checkbox specified with identifier. booleanValue is a boolean which defines the state

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the checkbox
    booleanValue : Boolean value to set the checkbox selection

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
booleanValue Yes boolean N/A

Examples:
Set Check Box State idCheckBox05 true

kw.name: Set Colorpicker Color
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword sets the color in the ColorPicker specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the ColorPicker component
    colorToSet : the color you want to set on the ColorPiker component. The Color must be in the hexadecimal format.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
colorToSet Yes string N/A


Examples:
/#colorPiker 0x0000ffff Datepicker Date Should Be

kw.name: Set Datepicker Date
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword sets the date in the DatePicker specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the DatePicker component
    date : the date you want to set on the DatePicker component. The Date must be in the dd-mm-yyyy format.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
date Yes string N/A


Examples:
/#datePicker Set Datepicker Date 01-01-2017

kw.name: Set File Path
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword sets the folder path where you want to save screenshots, sets the filename, deletes files with the same name in this folder and resets the counter of screenshots. filePath specifies the path and fileName specifies the filename. If an error occurs a TestFxLibraryNonFatalException is thrown.

Parameters:
    filePath : Path of the folder where you want to save screenShots
    fileName : Name that you want to give to Screenshots
    format : Image format

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
filePath Yes string N/A
fileName Yes string N/A

Examples:
Set File Path E:\MyFolder\MyInnerFolder\ myFile

kw.name: Set Hyperlink Status
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword set the status of an Hyperlink specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the Hyperlink component
    value : the value of the Hyperlink status

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
value Yes string N/A


Examples:
/#hyperlink Set Hyperlink Status true

kw.name: Set Scroll Bar Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword sets the scroll bar value to a specified value.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component
    value : The value to be set

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
value Yes float N/A

Examples:
Set Scroll Bar Value \#scrollbar 105.2

kw.name: Set Scroll Pane Horizontal Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword sets the horizontal value of a scroll pane specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component
    value : The new horizontal value

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
value Yes float N/A


Examples:
Set Scroll Pane Horizontal Value \#scrollpane 0.1

kw.name: Set Scroll Pane Vertical Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword sets the vertical value of a scroll pane specified by an identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component
    value : The new vertical value

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
value Yes float N/A


Examples:
Set Scroll Pane Vertical Value \#scrollpane 0.45

kw.name: Set Timeout
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword sets the timeout used for waiting for a component. Timeout name is specified with timeoutName and timeout in seconds is specified with timeoutInSeconds.

Parameters:
    timeoutName : Timeout name
    timeoutInSeconds : Timeout in seconds

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
timeoutName Yes string N/A
timeoutInSeconds Yes int (greater than 0) N/A

Examples:
Set Timeout GenericTimeout 20

kw.name: Sleep
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword pauses the execution during a period specified with milliseconds in milliseconds.

Parameters:
    seconds : The number of secunds to pause the execution

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
seconds Yes int N/A

Examples:
Sleep 250

kw.name: Spinner Decrement
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword decrements the value of a spinner identifier the amount steps that you want.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the spinner.
    steps : The amount of steps to decrement

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
steps Yes int N/A


Examples:
spinnerTest 100 Spinner Decrement 99

kw.name: Spinner Get Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword returns the value on a spinner identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the spinner.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Returns:
    the int valeu of the spinner

Examples:
spinnerTest Spinner Get Value 100

kw.name: Spinner Increment
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword increments the value of a spinner identifier the amount steps that you want.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the spinner.
    steps : The amount of steps to increment

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
steps Yes int N/A


Examples:
spinnerTest 100 Spinner Increment 101

kw.name: Spinner Set Value
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword set the value of a spinner identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the spinner.
    value : The value to set on the spinner.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
value Yes int N/A


Examples:
spinnerTest Spinner Get Value 100

kw.name: Spinner Value Should Be
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword verify the value of a spinner identifier and confirm if the value match the value provided valueToValidate

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the spinner.
    valueToValidate : The value to compare with the spinner value

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
valueToValidate Yes int N/A


Examples:
spinnerTest 100 Spinner Value Should Be

kw.name: Start Application
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword launches JavaFX application. The classname passed as className must extend javafx.application.Application.
IMPORTANT: The class must be added to the classpath beforehand.

Parameters:
    className : The name of the class that extends javafx.application.Application to be launched
    distinctiveName : The name to identify the session of the application

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
className Yes string
distinctiveName No string N/A
args No string or list of strings N/A

Examples:
Start Application AnApplication Application1 myCustomArguments

kw.name: Start JAR Application
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword launches JavaFX application from external JAR.
The classname given must extend javafx.application.Application.
IMPORTANT: The JAR must be added to the classpath beforehand.

Parameters:
    applicationJAR : The path of the JAR that contains the application to be launched
    className : The name of the class im the JAR that extends javafx.application. Application to be launched

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
applicationJAR Yes string N/A
className Yes string N/A

Examples:
Start Jar Application ajarfile.jar AnApplication

kw.name: Switch Application
kw.doc:
Description: Switch application if more than one is running.
Parameters:
    application : The name of the application to request the focus

Returns:
    : A list of applications

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
application Yes string N/A


Examples:
Switch Application my application

kw.name: Tab Item Should Be Selected
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword fails if a tab specified by tab is not selected in a tab pane specified by identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component
    tab : The text of the tab

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
tab Yes string N/A

Examples:
Tab Item Should Be Selected \#tabPane Tab One

kw.name: Tab Item Should Not Be Selected
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword fails if a tab specified by tab is selected in a tab pane specified by identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component
    tab : The text of the tab

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
tab Yes string N/A

Examples:
Tab Item Should Not Be Selected \#tabPane Tab One

kw.name: Tab Should Be Disabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword fails if a tab specified by tab is enabled in a tab pane specified by identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component
    tab : The text of the tab

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
tab Yes string N/A

Examples:
Tab Should Be Disabled \#tabPane Tab One

kw.name: Tab Should Be Enabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword fails if a tab specified by tab is not enabled in a tab pane specified by identifier.


Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component
    tab : The text of the tab

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
tab Yes string N/A

Examples:
Tab Should Be Enabled \#tabPane Tab One

kw.name: Table Cell Should Contain
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword checks if a given cell in a table contains specified text. Table is specified with identifier; rowIndex and columnIndex identify row and column indexes, respectively. text specifies text to be validated. If the given cell does not contain text a TestFxLibraryNonFatalException is thrown. First row and column indexes are 0, which does not correspond to headers. An Exception is thrown if index values are out of range.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the table
    rowIndex : Row to get the value from. first line index is 0
    columnIndex : Column to get the value from. first column index is 0
    text : Text to compare

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
rowIndex Yes int (0 to max row index) N/A
columnIdex Yes int (0 to max column index) N/A
text Yes string N/A

Examples:
Table Cell Should Contain idTable05 5 15 Hello World

kw.name: Table Header Should Contain
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword validates if a text is equal to some text header in a table. identifier specifies table and text specifies text. If text is not equal a TestFxLibraryNonFatalException is thrown.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the table
    text : The text to compare

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
text Yes string N/A

Examples:
Table Header Should Contain idTable12 Hello World

kw.name: Table Row Should Contains
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword validates if a text is present on a given table and row. identifier specifies the table, row specifies the row number and text specifies the text to be found on that table row. If text is not found a TestFxLibraryNonFatalException is thrown.

Parameters:
    identifier :The id of the table
    row :row oh the table
    text :text to compare

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
rowIndex Yes int (0 to max row index) N/A
text Yes string N/A

Examples:
tableRowShouldContains idTable05 5 Hello World

kw.name: Table Should Be Visible
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword checks if a table is visible. This table is specified with identifier. If the table is not visible an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the table

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Table Should Be Visible idTable05

kw.name: Table Should Contain
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword validates if a text is present in a given table. Table is specified with identifier and text specifies text to compare. If text is not found within identifier a TestFxLibraryNonFatalException is thrown.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the table
    text : Text to compare

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
text Yes string N/A

Examples:
Table Should Contain idTable12 Hello World

kw.name: Table Should Not Be Visible
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword checks if a table is not visible. This table is specified with identifier. If the table is visible an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the table

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Table Should Not Be Visible idTable05

kw.name: Text Area Append Text
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword add text to the current text in the TextArea. The TextArea is specified with identifier and text to add is specified with textToValidate.

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the label you want to verify.
    text : The text you want to add

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
textToValidate Yes string N/A

Examples:
Text Area Append Text textArea2 Text to add

kw.name: Text Area Text Should Be
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword validates the text in a text area. The text area is specified with identifier and the text to validate is specified with textToValidate. If the text in the text area does not match textToValidate a TestFxLibraryNonFatalException is thrown.


Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the text area you want to verify.
    textToValidate : The text you want to validate

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
textToValidate Yes string N/A

Examples:
Text Area Text Should Be TextArea02 Hello world

kw.name: Text Field Append Text
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword add text to the current text in the TextField. The TextField is specified with identifier and text to add is specified with textToValidate.

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the label you want to verify.
    text : The text you want to add

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
textToValidate Yes string N/A

Examples:
Text Field Append Text textField2 Text to add

kw.name: Text Field Text Should Be
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword validates text in a text field. Text field is specified with identifier and text to validate is specified with textToValidate. If text in the text field does not match textToValidate a TestFxLibraryNonFatalException in thrown.


Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the text field you want to verify.
    textToValidate : The text you want to validate

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
textToValidate Yes string N/A

Examples:
Text Field Text Should Be TextField02 Hello world

kw.name: Toggle Button Should Be Disabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword checks if the ToggleButton specified by an identifier is Disable.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the ToggleButton component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
/#toggleButton ToggleButton Should Be Disabled

kw.name: Toggle Button Should Be Enabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword checks if the ToggleButton specified by an identifier is Enabled.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the ToggleButton component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
/#toggleButton ToggleButton Should Be Enabled

kw.name: Togglebutton Button Should Be Selected
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword checks if the ToggleButton specified by an identifier is selected.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the ToggleButton component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
/#toggleButton ToggleButton Button Should Be Selected

kw.name: Togglebutton Button Should Not Be Selected
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword checks if the ToggleButton specified by an identifier is not selected.


Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the ToggleButton component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
/#toggleButton ToggleButton Button Should Not Be Selected

kw.name: Tool Bar Should Be Disabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword fails if a toolbar specified by identifier is enabled.
Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
Tool Bar Should Be Disabled \#toolbar

kw.name: Tool Bar Should Be Enabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword fails if a toolbar specified by identifier is not enabled.
Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
Tool Bar Should Be Enabled \#toolbar

kw.name: Tooltip Text Should Be
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword verifies it a given text is the same as the tooltip text found on the identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the component
    text : The text that you want to compare //.

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
text Yes string N/A

Examples:
Tooltip Text Should Be textfield Hello World

kw.name: Tree View Should Be Disabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if TreeView specified by an identifier is disabled.

Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the Hyperlink component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
TreeView Should Be Disabled /#treeView

kw.name: Tree View Should Be Enabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword check if TreeView specified by an identifier is enabled.

Parameters:
    identifier : the id of the Hyperlink component

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
TreeView Should Be Enabled /#treeView

kw.name: Type
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword types the keycode specified with keycode.


Parameters:
    keycode : The keycode to be typed

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
keycode Yes string N/A

Examples:
Type A
Type b
Type DIGIT0
Type F10


For more information on keycodes see: https://docs.oracle.com/javafx/2/api/javafx/scene/input/KeyCode.html

kw.name: Unselect From List By Position
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword clears selection on a listview by position. identifier specifies listview and position specifies position.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the listview
    position : position on listview

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
position Yes integer N/A

Examples:
Unselect From List By Position idListView8B 12

kw.name: Unselect From List By Text
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword clears selection on a listview by text. identifier specifies listview and text specifies text to identify item.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the listview
    text : The text to identify selection to clear

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
text Yes string N/A

Examples:
Unselect From List By Text idListView8B Hello world

kw.name: Unselect Tree Node By Index
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword unselects a Tree Item on the specified index index from a Tree View identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The id of the Tree View.
    index : The index of the element

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
index Yes int N/A


Examples:
treeView Select Tree Node By Index 2

kw.name: Verify That Has Child
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword verifies if the component specified with identifierToValidate is a child to the component specified with identifier. If identifierToValidate is not a child of identifier an error message is displayed.

Parameters:
    identifier : The component you want to verify as parent
    identifierToValidate : The component you want to verify as child

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
identifierToValidate Yes string N/A

Examples:
Verify That Has Child idPane

kw.name: Verify That Has Text
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword verifies if a component specified with identifier contains text specified with textToValidate. If the component does not contain the given text an error message is displayed.

Parameters:
    identifier : The component you want to validate
    textToValidate : The text you want to validate

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
textToValidate Yes string N/A

Examples:
Verify That Has Name idButton click here

kw.name: Verify That Is Disabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword verifies if a component specified with identifier is disabled. If the given component is enabled an error message is displayed.

Parameters:
    identifier : The component you want to verify

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Verify That Is Disabled idButton

kw.name: Verify That Is Enabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword verifies if a component specified with identifier is enabled. If the given component is disabled an error message is displayed.

Parameters:
    identifier : The component you want to verify

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Verify That Is Enabled idButton

kw.name: Wait Until Element Contains
kw.doc:
Description:This keyword waits until given component contains textToValidate. Fails if timeout expires before the text appears on given component specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The name of the component that you are going to test
    textToValidate : The Text you want to validate
    timeout : The time limit to complete the test

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
textToValidate Yes string N/A
timeout No int 20

Examples:
Wait Until Element Contains idComponent01 250
Wait Until Element Contains idComponent3a

kw.name: Wait Until Element Does Not Contains
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword waits until given component does not contain textToValidate. Fails if timeout expires before the text disappears from given component specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The name of the component that you are going to test
    textToValidate : The Text you want to validate
    timeout : The time limit to complete the test

Parameters Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
textToValidate Yes string N/A
timeout No int 20

Examples:
Wait Until Element Does Not Contain idComponent01 250
Wait Until Element Does Not Contain idComponent3a

kw.name: Wait Until Element Is Disabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword waits until component specified with identifier is disabled. Fails if timeout expires before the component is disabled.

Parameters:
    identifier : The name of the component that you are going to test
    timeout : The time limit to complete the test

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
timeout No int 20

Examples:
Wait Until Element Is Disabled idComponent01 250
Wait Until Element Is Disabled idComponent3a

kw.name: Wait Until Element Is Enabled
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword waits until component specified with identifier is enabled. Fails if timeout expires before the component is enabled.

Parameters:
    identifier : The name of the component that you are going to test
    timeout : The time limit to complete the test

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
timeout No int 20

Examples:
Wait Until Element Is Enabled idComponent01 250
Wait Until Element Is Enabled idComponent3a

kw.name: Wait Until Element Is Not Visible
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword waits until component specified with identifier is not visible. Fails if timeout expires before the component is not visible.

Parameters:
    identifier : The name of the element that you are going to test
    timeout : The time limit to complete the test

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
timeout No int 20

Examples:
Wait Until Element Is Not Visible idComponent01 250
Wait Until Element Is Not Visible idComponent3a

kw.name: Wait Until Element Is Visible
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword waits until component specified with identifier is visible. Fails if timeout expires before the component is visible.

Parameters:
    identifier : The name of the component that you are going to test
    timeout : The time limit to complete the test

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
timeout No int 20

Examples:
Wait Until Element Is Visible idComponent01 250
Wait Until Element Is Visible idComponent3A2

kw.name: Wait Until Page Contains
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword waits until component specified with text containing identifier appears on current page. Fails if timeout expires before the element appears.

Parameters:
    identifier : Text to identify the component that you are going to test
    timeout : The time limit to complete the test

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
timeout No int 20

Examples:
Wait Until Page Contains idComponent01 250
Wait Until Page Contains idComponent3a

kw.name: Wait Until Page Contains Element
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword waits until component specified with identifier appears on current page. Fails if timeout expires before the element appears.

Parameters:
    identifier : The name of the component that you are going to test
    timeout : The time limit to complete the test

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
timeout No int 20

Examples:
Wait Until Page Contains Element idComponent01 250
Wait Until Page Contains Element idComponent3a

kw.name: Wait Until Page Does Not Contain Element
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword waits until component specified with identifier disappears from current page. Fails if timeout expires before the element disappears.

Parameters:
    identifier : The name of the element that you are going to test
    timeout : The time limit to complete the test

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
timeout No int 20

Examples:
Wait Until Page Does Not Contain Element idComponent01 250
Wait Until Page Does Not Contain Element idComponent3a

kw.name: Wait Until Page Does Not Contains
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword waits until component specified with text containing identifier disappears from current page. Fails if timeout expires before the element disappears.

Parameters:
    identifier : Text to identify the component that you are going to test
    timeout : The time limit to complete the test

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A
timeout No int 20

Examples:
Wait Until Page Does Not Contain idComponent01 250
Wait Until Page Does Not Contain idComponent3a

kw.name: Wait Until Progress Bar Is Complete
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword wait until the Progress Bar specified with identifier is completed given the timeout.
Parameters:
    identifier : The progress bar id
    timeout : The timeout

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A


Examples:
Wait Until Progress Bar Is Complete \# progressBarId timeout

kw.name: Window
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword chooses a specific window specified with identifier.

Parameters:
    identifier : The identifier of the window

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
identifier Yes string N/A

Examples:
Window idWindow23

kw.name: Write
kw.doc:
Description: This keyword writes text on the focused component. It does not accept special characters (eg. a text field).


Parameters:
    text : The text to be written

Parameter Mandatory Values Default
text Yes string N/A

Examples:
Write Hello world
Write Hello world
